message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper deals with natural language tasks and graphical models, which are commonly used in computational linguistics and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the trade-off between exact and approximate inference, which is a common topic in machine learning and statistics, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category. The paper introduces a new approach to graphical models, which involves choosing the amount of context at run-time, making it relevant to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The empirical evaluation involves natural language tasks that require understanding of visual information, suggesting that cs.CV (Computer Vision) is also a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper uses probabilistic models, which is a common topic in cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), making it a less likely but still possible sub-category.
